Authors:
Nicolás García, Agostina B. Sassone, Raquel Pinto, Maria
José Roman
Title:
Atacamallium minutiflorum (Amaryllidaceae, Allioideae), new
genus and species from the coastal desert of northern Chile
Abstract:
Atacamallium, a new genus in
Amaryllidaceae-Allioideae-Leucocoryneae, is introduced with a
description of its type species Atacamallium minutiflorum, endemic to
the coastal Atacama Desert of northern Chile. Phylogenetic analyses of
DNA sequences, along with morphological data characters and its
distribution pattern, support the new genus and place it as a putative
sister to Leucocoryne, which is readily distinguished from Atacamallium
by its floral morphology. Atacamallium minutiflorum can be distinguished
from other species of Leucocoryneae by its overall smaller flowers,
tepals fused only at the base, six stamens in a single series, and
trifid stigma. A morphological description, a distribution map, an
illustration, and the assessment of the conservation status of the new
species, besides an updated key to the genera of Leucocoryneae, are
provided. Additional data from multiple single- copy nuclear genes are
needed to clarify the relationships within the tribe.
